Hi Lukasz!

• open the Dev Tools > Network tab in your browser
• copy the body of the failing request
• send it to us?
That can help us understand what the problem is.

text:
Hey Tony.

I don't think your validator state has anything to do with this request, given that what you're doing here is querying the API exposes by one of the SV nodes directly (your validator node should not be involved at all in this process).

 If I'm not mistaken TestNet is on migration-id `4`, so might be worth trying to use that one as input.

elements.text: That's fair. Just tried resolving the links for participants but hitting a dead end here

[canton@daycanton02 ~]$ telnet 172.18.0.6 7575
Trying 172.18.0.6...
Connected to 172.18.0.6.
Escape character is '^]'.
^]
telnet> quit
Connection closed.
[canton@daycanton02 ~]$ telnet 172.18.0.6 5002
Trying 172.18.0.6...
Connected to 172.18.0.6.
Escape character is '^]'.
▒^]
telnet> quit
Connection closed.
[canton@daycanton02 ~]$ ping 172.18.0.6
PING 172.18.0.6 (172.18.0.6) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 172.18.0.6: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.549 ms
64 bytes from 172.18.0.6: icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=0.170 ms
so we can hit the port that the participant container exposes but the api is just not working for us

Notice in your nginx.conf, it is listening on port 80, for requests with server

, and mapping those internally to the participant container, port 7575.
